articles.title: Greetings to Grand Duke of Luxembourg
articles.content:
Greetings to Grand Duke of Luxembourg
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Grand Duke of Luxembourg Henri on its national day.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms and wished Luxembourg development and prosperity.

articles.title: Floral Basket and Bouquet to DPRK Missions from Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Bouquet to DPRK Missions from Foreign Personages
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, sent a floral basket to the DPRK mission in Hong Kong, China on June 18 on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, sent a bouquet to the DPRK embassy in Cotonou on June 7.

articles.title: Revolutionary Opera "The Flower Girl" Acclaimed by Chinese Audience
articles.content:
Revolutionary Opera "The Flower Girl" Acclaimed by Chinese Audience
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary opera "The Flower Girl" was staged in Lanzhou City of Gansu Province, China, evoking lively response among audience. 
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by audience.
					
					 The deputy mayor of the city had this to say:
					
					 I watched an excellent performance.
					
					 I was mesmerized by the Korean arts.
					
					 The opera is high in its ideological value and artistry.
					
					 The youngsters do not know well about the past when the people were subject to exploitation and oppression.
					
					 I think the opera has a very high educational value.
					
					 A Chinese citizen said he could not keep back tears while watching the opera. The acting of actors and actresses was so truthful that it was a reminder of the past when the people were subject to all sorts of maltreatment and contempt.
					
					 A member of the doctoral institute of a college for agricultural vocation and technology in the city said that the opera provided an opportunity to know well that Korean arts are on a high level.
					
					 The deputy managing director of a company managing the Gansu Grand Theater stressed that many art troupes gave performances at the grand theater but none of them has ever won such acclaim and cheers of audience as the revolutionary opera "The Flower Girl."

articles.title: Pyongyang Takes on New Look along Banks of River Taedong
articles.content:
Pyongyang Takes on New Look along Banks of River Taedong
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The capital city of Pyongyang is now taking on new looks along the banks of the River Taedong.
					 Sin Song Un, a woman living in Kaesong City, told KCNA:
					
					 "I was fascinated by the view of Pyongyang city from Rungna Bridge built across the River Taedong. The city has changed so much from what I saw in October last year."
					
					 The bridge commands a complete view of the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill, People's Theatre, high-rises in Changjon Street as well as Ryugyong Health Complex and People's Open-Air Ice Rink now under construction.
					
					 A pleasure ground is being built at the final stage on Rungna Islet in the river, Pyongyang Folklore Park near its upper reach and a sports village on Yanggak Islet in the middle of the river.
					
					 The Mangyongdae Funfair in southwestern Pyongyang is being face-lifted.
					
					 Nam Kyong Jin, an officer of the Korean People's Army involved in the construction of the Rungna People's Pleasure Ground, said:
					
					 "The servicepersons and civilians are now working hard to bring earlier the rosy future.
					
					 I will do my best to finish as early as possible the construction of the funfair associated with the dear respected Kim Jong Un's loving care for the people."

articles.title: Moving into to New Flats Begins in Changjon Street of Pyongyang
articles.content:
Moving into to New Flats Begins in Changjon Street of Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Changjon Street has been built fashionably in the Mansudae area of Pyongyang, the capital city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 There are in the street edifices, skyscrapers and multi-storied apartment houses, public buildings and welfare and service centers.
					
					 All of them were put on the basis of formative art and they are enclosed in a beautiful park.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il initiated building the street in his lifetime in an aim to make Pyongyang City more magnificent, centered around Mansu Hill where the statue of President Kim Il Sung stands.
					
					 He took measures for its smooth construction in a short period, ranging from its layout and labor forces to supply of building materials. 
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un paid deep attention to building the Mansudae area on the highest level. He went to the construction site on several occasions, giving important instructions instrumental to making the street take on a new look as befitting the heart of the capital city.
					
					 Prior to its completion, he paid visits to restaurants, a nursery, kindergarten and primary school and even went up to the 45th floor of an apartment building, in consideration of the residents' convenience.
					
					 Moving to new houses in Changjon Street is now under way.

articles.title: Removal to New Houses in Full Swing in Changjon Street
articles.content:
Removal to New Houses in Full Swing in Changjon Street
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Changjon Street, newly built in the heart of Pyongyang City, is now immersed in a festive mood.
					 Seen in the street are removal vans arriving at the entrances of the apartment blocks and inhabitants carrying their furniture into their new houses.
					
					 Old woman Ri Hyong Sun told KCNA that she came to the street together with her son, daughter-in-law and grandsons as they were eager to have a look at the new house.
					
					 Among the new arrivals was Pak Hye Yong, a worker at the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory, who was busy looking round the admirably-built interior of her new house.
					
					 Also seen was a couple pondering over distribution of rooms to their family members.
					
					 All arrivals, including workers and scientists, were very satisfied with their new houses.
					
					 Cha Myong Uk, a war veteran, said:
					
					 "Now I feel very grateful to the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who paid deep attention to the building of Changjon Street to provide people with better living conditions. Comrade Kim Jong Un, thank you very much."
					
					 It is unimaginable in capitalist society where money is everything that ordinary working people are given new houses free of charge.
					
					 This is a glimpse of the advantages of the Korean-style socialist system centered on the masses."

articles.title: Hailstorm, Downpour Hit Some Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Hailstorm, Downpour Hit Some Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Hailstorm and heavy rain have been witnessed in some areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea while most areas are still suffering from a long spell of drought.
					 Hailstorm hit Pudok-ri and Chongchon-ri in Jaeryong County, South Hwanghae Province from 16:50 to 17:35 on June 12 and Sinjang-ri in Yonsa County, North Hamgyong Province from 14:55 to 15:30 on June 20.
					
					 Hails in Pudok-ri and Chongchon-ri were as big as 25mm in diameter on an average, 30-40mm to the maximum, and it hailed 12 cm and 6 cm in the areas respectively.
					
					 Hailstones as big as 5mm in diameter on an average hit Sinjang-ri for five minutes and the precipitation in the area was registered about 50mm for 30 minutes.
					
					 The hailstorm left some people wounded and dwelling houses destroyed. Maize, wheat and other crops of 200 hectares were damaged in Pudok-ri, dozens of hectares in Chongchon-ri and 150 hectares in Sinjang-ri.
					
					 Meanwhile, thunderstorm dumped up to 62 mm of rain in Sinhung County, South Hamgyong Province on June 11, 65mm in Yonggwang County of the same province on June 12 and 50mm in Chonma County and 52mm in Changsong County, North Phyongan Province, on June 15.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' First Defeat in Korean War
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' First Defeat in Korean War
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Sixty-two years has passed since the outbreak of the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953).
					 Starting the war, the U.S. imperialists vouched that they would win in it, but suffered bitter defeat.
					
					 This was well illustrated by the first battle fought between the Korean People's Army and the U.S. forces in the war.
					
					 According to the operational plan of President Kim Il Sung, the KPA promptly stopped the enemy's attack and switched over to a counteroffensive, advancing southward after liberating Seoul City.
					
					 At that time, a KPA unit, which was advancing towards Phyongthaek and Taejon, encountered an advance unit of the U.S. ground forces in Osan area. The U.S. unit was made up of the 1st Battalion of the 21st Regiment and the 52nd Artillery Battalion under the 24th Division, called "Smith commandos".
					
					 In this first battle with the U.S. forces, the 30th Tank Regiment of the KPA overpowered the enemy's artillery battalion, while the KPA 18th Infantry Regiment encircled the commando unit to annihilate it, winning in the battle.

articles.title: U.S., Provocateur of Korean War
articles.content:
U.S., Provocateur of Korean War
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The United States was the provocateur of the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953).
					 The then U.S. president, Harry S. Truman, appointed Douglas MacArthur commander of the U.S. forces in the Far East and instructed him to work out scenarios for aggression on the Far East including a war against the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 Accordingly, a military strategy plan on "northern expedition" was drawn up early in 1949. It reflected the U.S. imperialists' intention to occupy Pyongyang and Wonsan of the DPRK through landing on the east and west coasts of Korea along with the frontal attack in the area of the 38th parallel and then expand their offensive toward the border areas along Rivers Amnok and Tuman.
					
					 This plan was examined and rectified from late 1949 to early 1950.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists raised the military budget for bolstering up its armed forces to play a leading role in the war while stepping up the formation and expansion of the south Korean forces.
					
					 To take full command of the south Korean forces, the U.S. appointed American officers to major posts of the south Korean military and made them take charge of military education and training of troops.
					
					 It also set up tens of its military bases in south Korea and armed local troops with U.S.-made weapons while inventing pretexts to hurl armed forces of the U.S. and its allies into the war.
					
					 Meanwhile, preparations were made to use Japan's military bases and forces in the war.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists, in collusion with the south Korean forces, made steady military provocations along the 38th parallel in a bid to find a pretext for shifting the blame for the outbreak of the war on to the DPRK. Such provocations were committed on more than 5 000 occasions from 1947 to the brink of the Korean War.
					
					 On the basis of careful preparations, they unleashed the war on June 25, 1950.

articles.title: 100th Performance of Opera "Evgeni Onegin" Staged
articles.content:
100th Performance of Opera "Evgeni Onegin" Staged
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The 100th performance of opera "Evgeni Onegin" was staged at the music hall of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory on Friday.
					 Enjoying the performance were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials in the fields of literature and arts and media.
					
					 Teachers and students of the Conservatory successfully recreated the Russian opera "Evgeni Onegin" which was watched by President Kim Il Sung in 1958.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il guided the recreation of the opera in June 2009.
					
					 Based on Pushkin's novel and composed by Tchaikovsky the opera exposes the corrupt life of the nobility and the unreasonable feudal society of Russia that reduce young people to good-for-nothing though they are obliged to do good things beneficial for the country.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience for its truthful representation of the original work.

articles.title: DPRK Magic Stars
articles.content:
DPRK Magic Stars
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Among magicians of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are Kim Thaek Song and his two sons, Kim Chol and Kim Kwang Chol.
					 Kim Thaek Song works as head of jugglery department at Pyongyang Acrobatic School, Kim Chol head of the Jugglery Creative Group and Kim Kwang Chol jugglery director at Pyongyang Circus. All of them are winners of Kim Il Sung Prize and People's Artistes.
					
					 Born in Jagang Province, Kim Thaek Song started his career as a magician in the workers' art group at a factory.
					
					 Under the deep care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, he rose to fame at home and abroad for his high-level artistic skill.
					
					 He proved successful at various international magic festivals, including the 9th World Magic Festival in 1972.
					
					 He was awarded the title of magic king twice, one in the 16th international modern magic festival and the other in the year 1985.
					
					 Kim Chol, his first son, won a top prize and a trophy in the 19th International Modern Magic Festival. His works "Girls Reflected in Mirror" and "Bountiful Catfish" have enjoyed great popularity.
					
					 His second son, Kim Kwang Chol, is also famous for his special magic talents. He won the title in the 20th International Modern Magic Festival.
					
					 The three made a big contribution to creating a large-scale magic performance given successfully at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang last year.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Last-Ditch Efforts
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Last-Ditch Efforts
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea let loose a spate of such stereotyped rubbish as "provocation by the north" and "punishment". This is just the last-ditch efforts of one on the deathbed. 
					 Minju Joson Friday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Lee's deliberate provocation plunged into a deadlock the inter-Korean relations that had favorably developed since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, increasing the danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 By spreading the story about "provocation by the north" the traitor has worked hard to divert elsewhere public harsh criticism of him and buy time to tide over the ruling crisis in a bid to prolong his remaining days. 
					
					 But such a trick resulted in adding fuel to the fire.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK are waiting for an order to wipe out the group of traitors, ready to take part in the sacred war of retaliation.
					
					 The south Korean people are increasing the anti-Lee Myung Bak struggle, urging the traitor to stop remarks that get on the nerves of the north and fan up confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Days are numbered when the traitor like a dotard will have to pay a very high price for his remarks.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Strategic Line of Building Thriving Socialist Nation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Strategic Line of Building Thriving Socialist Nation
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un clarified that single-minded unity and invincible military power plus industrial revolution in the new century precisely mean a thriving socialist nation. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 This is the strategic line which the army and the people of the DPRK should consistently hold fast to in the effort to build a thriving socialist nation, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 It is the highest goal of the Workers' Party of Korea to build a thriving socialist nation in which national power is strong, everything prospers and people lead a happy life with nothing to desire more in the world.
					
					 The single-minded unity is the greatest national power firmly guaranteeing a bright prospect and future of the country and the nation. This is an icon of the solidity and invincibility of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 No matter how much water may flow under the bridge and how frequently a generation is replaced by another, the single-minded unity of the DPRK where the leader, the party, the army and the people are united close as one serves as an eternal banner of victory in the effort for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Arms guarantee the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation. This is the precious truth taught by the history of the Korean revolutionary struggle.
					
					 The DPRK has waged a dynamic struggle for building a thriving socialist nation, winning victory after victory in the fierce confrontation with imperialists, because it has powerful military capability. 
					
					 The development of science and technology is a major criterion for a country's economic potential at present. The level of scientific and technological development means that of national power and economic power.
					
					 The industrial revolution in the new century is the fruition of the patriotic devotion leader Kim Jong Il made by foreseeing future, not merely taking the trial facing the country into consideration, sowing seeds and cultivating them with care.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK will certainly build a Juche-oriented thriving nation on this land in hearty response to the strategic line laid down by Kim Jong Un, the article concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Eliminating Pro-U.S. Forces in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Eliminating Pro-U.S. Forces in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea is despicable pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese lackeys who sell off the dignity and interests of the nation, staking their fates on the outside forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The conservative group is so dependent on the U.S. that it zealously helps it realize its wild ambition to dominate the whole of Korea while openly claiming that "south Korea can never exist without the U.S." and "it can prosper only under its support."
					
					 The group, not content with toeing the U.S. policy, is backing Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, in its moves to stage a comeback to Korea, kowtowing to it. 
					
					 The Lee group is the anti-peace, anti-reunification forces as it has stood in the way of national reconciliation and unity and escalated confrontation with the DPRK and tension in collusion with outside aggressors. 
					
					 The inter-Korean relations had favorably developed since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. They, however, were brought to uncontrollable collapse and a touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula. This is the inevitable consequences of the Lee Myung Bak group's sycophancy towards the U.S.
					
					 People from all walks of life in south Korea have staged massive actions against Lee and the "Saenuri Party," driving the conservative group into an extreme ruling crisis. Much upset by this, the group seeks to find a way out of it in toeing the U.S. policy, its inveterate bad habit.
					
					 Lee and the clan of the "Saenuri Party" are a group of the thrice-cursed traitors as they are hell bent on treasons to prolong their remaining days and stay in power under the patronage of outside forces. 
					
					 It is the most urgent demand of the times to flush out pro-U.S. forces in south Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Assails U.S.-S. Korea Military Nexus
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Assails U.S.-S. Korea Military Nexus
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the second foreign and defense ministerial talks between the U.S. and south Korea took place in Washington. At the talks the south Korean side agreed on the joint operation of the anti-missile system with the U.S., citing "missile threats" from the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined commentary says in this regard:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group begged for U.S. sustained provision of the "extended nuclear deterrence" and the U.S. responded to it. This is a clear revelation of the adventurous attempt of the warmongers at home and abroad to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 This fully shows the criminal nature of the U.S. and south Korea which threaten the existence and security of the Korean nation while intensifying the military cooperation and conspiracy for invasion of the DPRK under the pretext of the non-existent "threat from it".
					
					 What matters is that at the talks the south Korean side actively fell in with the U.S. while vociferating about "expansion of the scope of the three-party security cooperation" among the U.S., Japan and south Korea. 
					
					 The evermore intensified moves of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for military conspiracy with the U.S. and Japanese masters aim at realizing the wild ambition for invasion of the DPRK by rounding off the formation of the "triangular military alliance" for aggression pursuant to the U.S. Asia strategy. These dangerous and reckless moves are aggravating the situation of not only the Korean Peninsula but also the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 The situation proves that the Lee group getting hell bent on military collusion with the U.S. and Japan bereft of reason is an arch criminal aggravating tension and harassing peace.

articles.title: Imperialists' Ideological Poisoning, Curtain Raiser to Aggression: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Imperialists' Ideological Poisoning, Curtain Raiser to Aggression: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning is the process which precedes their aggression and interference, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article.
					 The imperialists are blustering that bourgeois ideology and culture can do something that cannot be done by nukes, the article notes, disclosing their purposes.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is one of the aims of their ideological and cultural poisoning to westernize the ideology and culture of the anti-imperialist independent countries.
					
					 The imperialists cite "freedom" of thinking and cultural practice as an excuse for interfering in the internal affairs of other countries and encroaching upon their state sovereignty.
					
					 They are even mulling bringing down other countries' social systems, pulling them up over their "human right issues."
					
					 Another aim of the imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning is to set up governments courting their pleasure.
					
					 Its spearhead is directed to the socialist countries and anti-imperialist independent countries.
					
					 The above-mentioned facts go to prove that if a country is to achieve independent development and prosperity, it is the most important and urgent issue to ward off the imperialists' bourgeois ideological and cultural poisoning, the article notes, stressing:
					
					 Failure to wage a positive struggle to frustrate the imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning is as harmful as pricking one's own eyes.

articles.title: Saber-rattling of U.S.-and Japan-backed S. Korean Warmongers against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
Saber-rattling of U.S.-and Japan-backed S. Korean Warmongers against DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea (NPCK) in a statement Friday slammed the war moves and arms buildup stepped up by the south Korean  authorities in collusion with the U.S. and Japan under the pretext of "provocation and threat" from the DPRK.
					 These war drumbeats are pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of an all-out war and posing a serious threat to the peace and security in the region, the statement noted, and continued: 
					
					 The warlike forces claim their war moves are to cope with the "provocation and threat" from the north and that they are "annual defense exercises" but it is too cynical and sheer sophism to cover up their aggressive and provocative nature. 
					
					 It was none other than the south Korean puppet group which extremely rattled the nerves of the DPRK by crying out for striking the "set targets" in the wake of perpetrating ceaseless hideous provocations against it. It is again these brazen-faced puppet forces who are raising a hue and cry over the "nuclear and missile threats from the north" though they are imploring for the extension of range of missiles to do harm to fellow countrymen and partaking of the U.S. missile defense system. 
					
					 They are now zealously following the U.S. strategy for dominating Asia and the rest of the world and joining in the moves to cook up the tri-angular military alliance in a bid to shore up the pro-U.S. conservative regime isolated at home and abroad and driven to a crisis and turn the situation before the "presidential election" favorable for the conservative forces. 
					
					 These reckless military moves of the south Korean authorities to tide over the ruling crisis are pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia to the brink of a war. 
					
					 The service personnel and other people of the DPRK love peace but national dignity and the sovereignty of the country are dearer to them. That is why the DPRK is further bolstering up its armed forces. 
					
					 Provocateurs are fated to face a severe punishment hardly imaginable.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Marked in China
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Marked in China
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China held a meeting in China on June 11 to mark the 12th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the association, said that leader Kim Jong Il ensured the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, gave the warmth of reunification to the barrier of division frozen with distrust and confrontation for more than half a century, performing immortal feats to shine in the history of the movement for Korea's reunification 
					
					 All the achievements made in the movement for the country's reunification since the publication of the joint declaration are unthinkable without the tireless efforts and outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Il, she noted, and went on:
					
					 The puppet conservative group of south Korea, however, soon after it came to power brought to naught all the successes of the June 15 joint declaration, escalated the confrontation with the DPRK and fabricated hideous provocations, leading the inter-Korean relations to the brink of a war.
					
					 The Association and all the Koreans in China would conduct unflinching mass campaign to drive the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors to a ditch of history and preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The speakers praised the June 15 joint declaration as the most just and patriotic reunification program for the country's reunification and the prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 They called for turning out in the struggle to wipe out the anti-reunification group of traitors and achieve the reconciliation, unity, peace and reunification of the country.
					
					 A letter to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 Earlier, there was a photo and book exhibition on the theme of "By our nation itself".
					
					 The participants watched a Korean film on the same day.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Marked in Japan
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Marked in Japan
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Regional Committee under the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a seminar in Tokyo on June 19 to mark the 12th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration. It made public an appeal to the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad.
					 It is the unanimous desire and wish of the Korean nation to provide a turning phase for national reunification in significant 2012 marking the 40th anniversary of the July 4 joint declaration and the 5th anniversary of the October 4 declaration, practical programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 Now is the time for all Koreans who value their country and nation, desirous of national reunification, to turn out as one in the nationwide struggle to smash the challenge of anti-reunification forces and win back the June 15 era, said the appeal.
					
					 It called for creating an atmosphere of positively supporting and implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration throughout Korea and making the trend of the June 15 era of reunification prevail in the Korean peninsula again.
					
					 It is necessary to hold in check outsiders' interference and rackets for war and confrontation, bring about peace on the Korean Peninsula, shatter all sorts of anti-reunification moves and put into practice visits, exchange, dialogue and cooperation, it noted.
					
					 The appeal called for achieving wide-ranging solidarity and unity among the north, the south and overseas with the June 15 All-Korean Committee as the parent body.

articles.title: Koreans in China Flays U.S. Anti-DPRK Campaign
articles.content:
Koreans in China Flays U.S. Anti-DPRK Campaign
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Jo Kuk Je, secretary general of the General Association of Koreans in China, made public a statement on June 19 in denunciation of the U.S. anti-DPRK campaign. 
					 He said that the U.S. pulled up the DPRK over its "human rights issue" and "people's living". 
					
					 He termed the U.S. heinous enemy of mankind as it is being engrossed in aggression, terrorism, subversion, destruction and sabotage in different parts of the world. The U.S. imperialists are matchless brutes who massacred innocent people after turning the whole land of Korea into ashes during the Korean War, he said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. should behave itself, clearly understanding the foolish and shameless nature of its attempt to interfere in the internal affairs of the DPRK and break the single-minded unity of its people while talking about "human rights issue" and "people's living". 
					
					 The country in the grip of the biggest trouble over the people's living and right to existence is the U.S. where 99 percent of population is being exploited by one percent. 
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all the Koreans in China accuse the U.S. of despicably trying to break the single-minded unity of the DPRK where the leader, party and people are united as one, while talking about "human rights" and "people's living". 
					
					 The DPRK will defend Korean-style socialist system chosen by itself to the last.

articles.title: DPRK Enters New Historic Turn: Chinese Paper
articles.content:
DPRK Enters New Historic Turn: Chinese Paper
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The June 15-21 issue of the Chinese paper "International Herald Leader" carried an article of its correspondent in Pyongyang under the title "DPRK under half a year politics of leader Kim Jong Un".
					 The insight into international issues, grit and stratagem of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the firm faith of the party, government, army and the people of the DPRK in building a thriving nation help one know that the DPRK will display the new spirit without fail in the future, the paper said.
					
					 He is carrying forward the Songun politics true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il, it noted, adding that energetically providing field guidance, Kim Jong Un has pursued the politics of concern for the improvement of the standard of people's living and loving care for them.
					
					 It introduced in detail the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union.
					
					 The housing blocks built in the Mansudae area have become a new criterion for the modernization of Pyongyang, it noted, and went on:
					
					 To build Pyongyang into a world-level grand city was a lifetime desire of Kim Jong Il. Pyongyang will take on its peculiar character under the plan of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kwangbok Area Supermarket and other projects were completed one after another. Large-scale comprehensive, modern service facilities are being built on the picturesque bank of the River Taedong and the People's Open-Air Ice Rink and other projects are nearing their completion.
					
					 The people from across the country are visiting the statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill. The Kumsusan Palace of the Sun, the sacred temple of Juche where they lie in state, is visited by an endless stream of Koreans and foreigners.
					
					 All the work is being done in good order in the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Slogan boards set up in streets and conversations of the people signal that the DPRK has entered the era of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The phrase of new 100 years of Juche era is being used in the DPRK. This proves that the DPRK led by him has entered a new historic turn.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries published leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Present Times and the Tasks Facing Young People" in booklet on June 15.
					 The work, made public on October 12, 1988, clarifies that it is the sacred duty of the young people in the present era to devote themselves to the cause of independence against imperialism.
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled by the young people to carry forward the revolutionary cause of Juche generation after generation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Uruguayan and Ethiopian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Uruguayan and Ethiopian Papers
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Uruguayan paper La Juventud and Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor on June 14 carried the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People".
					 The work, made public on April 20, 2012, clarifies the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetime.
					
					 It also indicates tasks for upholding and preserving the ideas and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and glorifying them for all ages.
					
					 The Ethiopian paper carried the gist of the congratulatory speech made by Kim Jong Un at a joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations in celebration of the 66th birthday of the KCU.
					
					 The paper also carried the gist of Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Website of Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Website of Peruvian Organization
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its internet website on June 15 the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People".
					 The work, made public on April 20, 2012 clarifies the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung for the revolution and construction. It recalls that leader Kim Jong Il firmly upheld and protected the idea and cause of the President and wisely led the work to implement them.
					
					 The work also indicates tasks for firmly upholding and preserving the ideas and feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and glorifying them for all ages.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats in Party Building Praised by Personages of Democratic Congo, SwedenK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats in Party Building Praised by Personages of Democratic Congo, Sweden
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Democratic Congo and Sweden on June 9 and 13 to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association who is deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo said that Kim Jong Il formulated the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung as Kimilsungism with his energetic and extraordinary ideological and theoretical activities. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il proclaimed the programme on modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism and consolidated the single-minded unity of the leader, the party and the masses in every way, the chairman said, and went on:
					
					 He resolutely shattered the anti-DPRK moves of the imperialists and their allied forces, turned the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power and nuclear weapons state and opened up a bright prospect for building a thriving nation.
					
					 He opened the June 15 era of reunification in the idea of "By our nation itself" and greatly contributed to global independence. 
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association said that progressive people of the world, together with the Korean people, are recollecting with deep emotion the feats of Kim Jong Il who led the country to victory despite difficult ordeals.
					
					 By providing two north-south summits, he opened up a bright prospect for national reunification, the chairman noted.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Observed in Peru and Sweden
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Observed in Peru, Sweden
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- A solidarity meeting and lecture took place in Peru and Sweden respectively on June 12 to mark the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration. 
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland", said that the joint declaration represents a proposal for independent peaceful reunification based on the idea of "By the Korean nation itself" and a fair and aboveboard reunification formula agreed upon by the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and Lee Myung Bak group of traitors of south Korea should not abuse the reunification-oriented self-restraint of the DPRK, he held, and went on:
					
					 The progressive parties, friendship and solidarity organizations and people of Peru fully support the joint declaration and extend invariable solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK in their struggle for the independent peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, referred to the successes made in the Korean reunification movement since the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it.
					
					 The chief went on:
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un said that the WPK and the DPRK government would join hands with whoever truly wants the reunification of the country and peace and prosperity of the nation and make responsible and persevering efforts to accomplish the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, turned down all these proposals of the DPRK and staged ceaseless military exercises against compatriots in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					 Facts go to prove that the implementation of the north-south declarations is unthinkable and it is absolutely impossible to achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity as long as the present south Korean ruling forces are allowed to stay in power.
					
					 The north and south declarations must be implemented thoroughly to achieve the independent reunification of Korea and its peace and prosperity.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration is a milestone and banner for Korea's reunification as it was hailed and supported not only by all Koreans but by the whole world.

articles.title: Peaceful Reunification of Korea Supported by AAPSO Chief
articles.content:
Peaceful Reunification of Korea Supported by AAPSO Chief
Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Korea should be reunified independently and peacefully as early as possible in the spirit of "by the Korean nation itself" free from any outside interference, said Helmi El Hadidi, chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization (AAPSO) in a statement on June 11.
					 He said the adoption of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration marked a historic event in improving the inter-Korean relations, achieving the peace and prosperity of the Korean Peninsula and leading it to reunification. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' political and military provocations against the DPRK in recent years have caused serious consequences of deteriorating the inter-Korean relations and disturbing the peace and security of the peninsula, the chairman said, adding:
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un declared that the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK would join hands with whoever truly wants the reunification of the country and peace and prosperity of the nation and make responsible and persevering efforts to accomplish the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					 The chairman extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle for reunifying the country under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: WPK Became Powerful by Kim Jong Il: Bangladeshi Party Leader
articles.content:
WPK Became Powerful by Kim Jong Il: Bangladeshi Party Leader
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, issued a statement on June 13 to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Nearly half a century-long period since Kim Jong Il started his work at the WPK Central Committee was brilliant days when the DPRK made a great history for defending socialism and building a thriving nation, the chairman said, and went on:
					
					 As led by Kim Jong Il, the WPK could display its dignity as a powerful party with a strong sense of independence, not shaken even a bit despite all storms and ordeals of history.
					
					 The chairman expressed the firm conviction that the army and the people of the DPRK would surely win victory in the struggle to defend the socialist country and build a thriving nation under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Okinawa Prefectural Governor Opposes Deployment of U.S. Transport Plane
articles.content:
Okinawa Prefectural Governor Opposes Deployment of U.S. Transport Plane
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The governor of Okinawa opposed the planned temporary deployment of the accident-prone MV-22 Osprey aircraft at the U.S. airfield in the prefecture. He clarified this when he met the Japan foreign minister on June 19.
					 He urged the authorities to cancel the plan, saying the prefecture can not accept it.

articles.title: CNCDP denuncia acciones belicistas de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
CNCDP denuncia acciones belicistas de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ACNC) -- En su declaracion publicada este viernes, el portavoz del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP) condeno a las autoridades surcoreanas que recrudecen su campana belica contra el Norte de Corea y aumentan las fuerzas armadas escandalizando la supuesta "provocacion" y "amenaza" de alguien.
					Como consecuencia, la ya tensa situacion de la Peninsula Coreana llega a la fase de guerra total y se ven gravemente amenazadas la paz y la seguridad de la region, comienza la nota y prosigue:
					
					Son demasiado pueriles para disimular su atributo agresivo y ambicion de provocar los embustes de los belicistas orientados a justificar sus maniobras belicas, tales como "hacer frente a la provocacion y amenaza" de alguien y "ejercicios anuales de defensa".
					
					La camarilla de titeres surcoreanos cometio actos provocativos de gran dimension contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la irrito al maximo anunciando publicamente el "ataque de blancos especificos".
					
					Igualmente, pide a EE.UU. alargar el alcance de los misiles balisticos desplegados en suelo surcoreano para que estos artefactos puedan atacar todas partes de la connacional RPDC y se incorpora al establecimiento del sistema antimisiles norteamericano.
					
					A pesar de esto, los cinicos titeres surcoreanos estan cuestionando el arma nuclear y el misil de alguien.
					
					Al ser partidario activo de la estrategia norteamericana de dar importancia a Asia para tomar la hegemonia mundial y moverse con entusiasmo para la formacion de la alianza militar trilateral, ellos tratan de salvar su "poder" conservador proyanqui, aislado y repudiado dentro y fuera del pais, y cambiar a favor de las fuerzas conservadoras la situacion de las "elecciones presidenciales".
					
					Sus imprudentes pasos militares, encaminados a salir de la extremada crisis de gobernacion, llevan al punto limite con guerra la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y el Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					La RPDC aprecia la paz, pero considera mas valiosas la dignidad nacional y la soberania del pais. Por eso, empunara mas firmemente el fusil del Songun.
					
					A los provocadores les espera un castigo inimaginablemente severo.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta chismes repetidos de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta chismes repetidos de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ACNC) -- En estos dias, el traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak no se cansa de hablar de la supuesta "provocacion del Norte (de Corea)" y "castigo correspondiente".
					Tales chimes insinuan que el esta dando el ultimo coletazo para salir de su extremada crisis que lo amenaza de muerte, asi opina el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este viernes y continua:
					
					Debido a las provocaciones premeditadas del traidor Lee, se rompieron totalmente las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, que se desarrollaban favorablemente despues del 15 de Junio de 2000, y corre el peligro de guerra la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Al difundir el rumor de la "provocacion del Norte", Lee trata de esquivar las criticas de los indignados habitantes y ganar el tiempo necesario para remediar la crisis de gobernacion.
					
					Pero, tales artimanas estan acelerando la explosion de ira.
					
					Todos los militares y civiles de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, levantados en la justa y sagrada lucha de venganza, estan esperando la orden de que se aniquile a la banda de traidores surcoreanos.
					
					Por su parte, los habitantes surcoreanos intensifican la lucha anti-Lee Myung Bak demandandole dejar de cometer acciones conflictivas y provocativas a la RPDC.
					
					Lee tendra que pagar muy caro sus chismes.

articles.title: Opera coreana "La florista" deja impresionado al publico chino
articles.content:
Opera coreana "La florista" deja impresionado al publico chino
Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ACNC) -- El grupo artistico de Corea, que realiza una gira en China con la opera revolucionaria "La florista", estreno en la ciudad de Lanzhou de la provincia de Gansu.
					Profundamente impresionados de la opera, los espectadores chinos enviaron fuertes aplausos a los artistas coreanos expresando asi sus emociones:
					
					El subalcalde de Lanzhou dijo:
					
					Fue un espectaculo realmente magnifico.
					
					Me quede fascinado del arte coreano.
					
					La opera coreana tiene gran valor ideo-artistico.
					
					Los jovenes de nueva generacion no conocen bien del pasado en que fuimos explotados y oprimidos.
					
					Creo que la opera es un medio con mucho valor educativo.
					
					Un ciudadano destaco que vio la opera con lagrimas en los ojos. La actuacion de los artistas coreanos fue tan vivida que me hizo recordar el pasado de maltrato y desprecio, recalco.
					
					Un estudiante del instituto doctoral de una escuela de tecnologia profesional de agricultura apunto que la funcion le hizo conocer el alto nivel del arte coreano.
					
					El viceadministrador general de la Compania Limitada de Administracion del Gran Teatro de Gansu senalo que este teatro ha sido la sede de funcion de numerosas entidades artisticas, pero ninguna de ellas ha recibido los aplausos y aclamaciones tan fuertes como la opera coreana "La florista".
